item.title: Red Rocket, 2021 - ★★★½
item.description: Not at par with Anora and The Florida Project but it has enough of that Sean Baker goodness (genuineness, marginalized groups, sex, etc etc etc) to be worth a watch
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Friendship, 2024 - ★★★★½
item.description:
When the entire theater (except Sarah) cracked up at the very first micro facial expression Tim Robinson made in the opening seconds of the movie I knew we were in for a trip.

Hands down the most laughs I've ever heard in a movie theater (again, except for stony faced Sarah)

What I've always loved from ITYSL sketched is that never know if Tim is going to be the psycho and the other characters will be foils or vice versa (e.g. Hot Dog and Car Focus Group respectively). In this movie you get it both ways - you never know if a character will be in normal mode or psycho mode and that leads to some all-time lines like the sewer-gasm.

Can someone with a psychology of humor degree explain to me why Jimp is the funniest thing I've ever heard?

Exited to quote this ad nauseam for the rest of my life.

By the way did I mention how much Sarah hated this movie??
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Sideways, 2004 - ★★★★
item.description:
Immediately after watching: "cute sad/funny movie! Probably won't think about it too much after watching"

The next day: "hmm I am still thinking about some scenes"

The next day: *browsing Etsy for a shirt that says "I'm not drinking any fucking merlot*
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Bring Her Back, 2025 - ★★★
item.description:
Letterboxd Offers come through!! Got to see a free screening of this a month before its release.

Like Talk to Me, this was well shot and filled with horribly disturbing visual imagery. Unlike its predecessor however, it was loose and messy and fell into too many horror tropes for me to fully enjoy it.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Presence, 2024 - ★★★½
item.description:
We 👏🏼 love 👏🏼 a 👏🏼 tight 👏🏼 runtime

Can always count on Soderbergh for a no-wasted-moments film with creative camera work and interesting ideas

Brutal mis-marketing campaign though, this was absolutely not "one of the scariest movies you will see all year" as the trailer claimed. Is the rise of prestige horror causing it to become a victim of its own success??
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: One of Them Days, 2025 - ★★★★
item.description:
Fever dream screwball comedy and I loved it. More of this please!!

Keke and SZA were really funny but all of the minor characters had me howling (esp Katt Williams and Keyla Mejia)
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: A Complete Unknown, 2024 - ★★★
item.description: This was solid but musical biopics have such a low ceiling for me
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Sinners, 2025 - ★★★★
item.description:
Took a big swing -> scored a big hit. How many genres / tones / styles can one man smoosh into a movie?? But it totally works.

Michael B Jordan really had great chemistry with everyone in this movie, including and above all himself.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Black Bag, 2025 - ★★★½
item.description:
Just enough cinematic and directorial flair to make up for the run-of-the-mill spy plot.

Top wins
- 93 minute runtime
- Marisa Abela
- Black Bag becoming a part of my everyday conversations with my wife ("did you eat all of the leftovers we were saving for lunch?" "sorry sweetie, black bag")
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Heretic, 2024 - ★★★
item.description: The curse of the underwhelming third act horror movie continues! Why is it so hard to stick the landing with this genre?
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: It Happened One Night, 1934 - ★★★★
item.description:
If I start talking to Sarah the way Peter talks to Ellie what do you think would happen?

Also,

Idiot me, seeing Peter eating carrots raw and being called Doc: "I wonder if that is based on bugs bunny" 🤦🏼‍♂️🤦🏼‍♂️🤦🏼‍♂️
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Flow, 2024 - ★★★★½
item.description: You know what, hell yeah Latvia
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Companion, 2025 - ★★★½ (contains spoilers)
item.description:
This review may contain spoilers.

Ex Machina and Bodies Bodies Bodies had a baby
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Mickey 17, 2025 - ★★★
item.description:
First off, my utter adoration for Robert Pattinson is reaffirmed (not that it needed any reaffirmation), but that is where my positive commentary ends.

This had me hooked at first with its campy tone and interesting, heady ideas (the many yous you are), but then it didn't follow through on anything, got strange and flat-feeling and lost me completely. It was still entertaining throughout so I'll give it three bags of popcorn.

I also don't need any more Trump-ed up caricatures in the movies I watch - I get enough of that from the news.

Also also the creepers were totally Ohmus
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: I'm Still Here, 2024 - ★★★★
item.description:
No shade to my girl Mikey, but how tf did Fernanda not win...

MILD SPOILER BELOW

A fire alarm went off in our theater the exact moment that Rubens was being taken away by the police and it interrupted a critical vibe shift.

When we got back in our seats 30 minutes later the restart was abrupt and felt disjointed from the idyllic exposition of the first third of the movie.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: A Different Man, 2024 - ★★★½
item.description:
So meta it hurts, so cringe-inducing it kills, and darkly hilarious!

The trailer gives the entire arc of the movie away but I still had fun. Anyway, fuck trailers.

LITTLE SPOILER BELOW

Fun fact: this is the second movie in the past few months I've made Danny (who hates being grossed out) watch that involves someone graphically ripping apart their face or body
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Conclave, 2024 - ★★★★½ (contains spoilers)
item.description:
This review may contain spoilers.

Plot aside, this movie was awesome. The music, the acting, the compositions, the camerawork; everything was top tier. There were too many memorable freeze frame shots to count (though the trailer certainly tries to hit them all, don't watch it!)

DEEP SPOILERS BELOW

Plot considered, still great! My initial reaction after watching was that Lawrence's arc was the most resonant, and I would have rather seen that "reluctant leader" trope followed through (or was he reluctant?).

But after reflecting and discussing with the ski house I came around to really liking the twist ending, especially considering that Benitez needed Lawrence's acceptance before donning the white robes.

In my own personal headcannon, two things are true
- Lawrence would have won if that vote hadn't been interrupted by the bomber
- Benitez still voted for Lawrence in the last vote

I also loved the dichotomy of ancient customs and traditions with modern technology like coffee makers, computers, and phones.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Emilia Pérez, 2024 - ★½
item.description:
I know this has been getting ripped by folks since it got 13 noms but I had to find out for myself. It does indeed blow pretty hard. Bad music, shallow characterizations, strangely boring pacing, bizarre ending.

I'll give it a bag of popcorn for swinging big and telling a story that has never been told before — even if that swing was a pop fly. It also gets an extra half bag of popcorn for some creative lighting cues and camera movements.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: The Dark Knight, 2008 - ★★★★★
item.description:
Ski house rewatch. I can finally admit that from a plot-hole perspective this movie makes no fucking sense (apology for the betrayal, 15 year old me)

Still slaps though, and it still keeps its 5 bags of popcorn from a cultural significance and personal significance point of view
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: The Wild Robot, 2024 - ★★★½
item.description: Good time movie for a ski house. The robot was giving Iron Giant / WALL-E / Scavenger's Reign vibes. I liked all of the animation but the spotlight eyes sent me every time idk
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: The Brutalist, 2024 - ★★★★
item.description:
I knew beforehand that this movie would be in the "I would never enjoy this in any other setting besides a theater" category. I wish I had the setup/patience/attention to watch films like this at home but I know I do not -- so it was off to the theater for me.

And I loved it! The score, the pacing, the acting, the DRIP, the subtle (and not subtle) holocaust imagery, the long takes, the lighting was all top tier. The second scene alone was an all-time cinematic moment for me.

The movie was so meticulously paced that it left tons of room for injecting meaning and projections into it throughout and then getting surprised when it went in different directions. I am still reflecting on the meaning of certain choices and decisions and I am sure I will be whenever I think about this movie in the future.

Also, more movies should have intermissions.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Alien: Romulus, 2024 - ★★★★
item.description: I forgot to write the review after I saw this a few months ago so I don't totally remember how I felt, but I think I liked it in a "haha creepy alien go brrr" kinda way
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: A Real Pain, 2024 - ★★★★
item.description: Small, restrained movie with a big heart and solid emotional payoffs. Highlight of the movie was Jesse Eisenberg's dinner monologue.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: The Zone of Interest, 2023 - ★★★★
item.description: Watched on Monday January 29, 2024.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Babygirl, 2024 - ★★★
item.description: Surface level fun with some memorable scenes, but that is about it. If I hadn't seen it in a crowded theater this would be 2 stars, but some reactions got me remembering how much I love movies in theaters
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Nosferatu, 2024 - ★★★★
item.description: Inescapable dread, candlelit long takes, fun cinematic choices, what is not to love?? (besides the gratuitous gore, disturbing content, and psycho-sexual demonism I guess, but hey I liked that stuff too). This movie was absolutely drooling with style and has secured it's place as my second favorite Robert Eggers film (can't beat the VVitch)
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: War for the Planet of the Apes, 2017 - ★★★½
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: War for the Planet of the Apes
item.description: My least favorite so far of the MCU (monkey cinematic universe), but good enough for a plane watch
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Memory, 2023 - ★★★½
item.description: Danny watches a movie on a plane -> I watch a movie on a plane
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Anora, 2024 - ★★★★
item.description:
I waited a few weeks to write this review to figure out how much real estate it had in my head after watching. And it stayed with me! So I went up to 4 stars.

The were some abrupt tonal shifts between the three acts, but it stayed cohesive enough for me to be engaged throughout. Plus, in the moment the shifts didn't feel that jarring because you didn't really realize you were in a totally new compartment of the movie for a while.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Wicked, 2024 - ★★★★★ (contains spoilers)
item.description:
This review may contain spoilers.

There are so so many ways in which this entire project could have flopped hard and I am just glad I live in the universe in which they absolutely nailed it.

Definitely in the top three cinematic experiences of 2024 for me (Challengers, Godzilla Minus One). This one was just a pure, unadulterated good time.

My only tiny note is that I didn't like the break in music before "so if you care to find me". You gotta let that one build up and play through to maximize giving the audience goosebumps.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Trap, 2024 - ½
item.description: I think this is the worst movie I have ever watched (not in a good way)
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: The Substance, 2024 - ★★
item.description: The first third was interesting in premise and cinematography, but the rest of it was Coralie Fargeat saying "hold my Cronenberg, I'm going deeper"
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Smile 2, 2024 - ★★★½
item.description: Lost a bit of novelty, but that it just par for the course for a sequel. In the end there was enough creativity in the shooting and the sequences that I still liked it.
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Babes, 2024 - ★★★
item.description: A few lols throughout. Not Broad City tier but a fun way to pass some time. The twins sent me
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Perfect Days, 2023 - ★★★★
item.description: Gorgeous cinematography,, immaculate needle drops, top tier acting, this was a good one. I am a bit tossed up about the intended message of the third act but maybe that makes it even better!
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes, 2014 - ★★★½
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
item.description: Not as good as Rise, but still a fun watch. Excited to finish the rest of the new iteration next time I have a bi-coastal plane ride on United
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes, 2011 - ★★★★
item.letterboxd:filmTitle: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
item.description: Great action movie with a few "woah" moments. The effects/mocap were great and got me thinking about how we probably have been very near the top of the asymptote of FX for the past decade after the major step function increases of the early aughts
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Civil War, 2024 - ★★★
item.description: This was mostly meh with a few standout scenes and visuals. Mostly just the scene with Jesse Plemons
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: The Fall Guy, 2024 - ★★★★
item.description: I feel like you can really tell when the team making a movie had fun making it and this team definitely did. There are great stunts, good lols, and genuine chemistry amongst leads (how does Ryan do it???). A++ plane movie
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: A Quiet Place: Day One, 2024 - ★★½
item.description:
Highlights
- cat
- puppet

Lowlights
- the cat is an idiot
- absolutely no fun world building
- bizarre character choices
- inconsistent loudness of things
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: Alien, 1979 - ★★★★
item.description: Checking off another missed sci-fi classic from my list. The vibes, noises, and cinematography were immaculate. I thought the actual horror elements were a bit trope-y and dated, but made me appreciate how far the genre has come. Then again, maybe something can't be trope-y if it was the thing that invented the trope
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: mother!, 2017 - ★★★½
item.description:
Psychotic and disturbing but I liked it. This was not at all what I had been expecting but when the whole idea/symbolism of it clicked I ended up liking it.

Alt review for the first half: a Tim Robinson sketch but make it horror
item.dc:creator: Noah Eisen

item.title: The Longest Yard, 2005 - ★★★½
item.description: Somehow I missed this mid-aught classic

item.description: I asked Hashem what the meaning of this movie was but he didn't answer

item.description: Was it have a similar shape to the first one? Sure! But the first one was so good that there was plenty of room for more of the same

item.title: Anyone But You, 2023 - ★★½

item.description: Wait is Glen Powell a good actor?? This was a fun one

item.title: The Beekeeper, 2024 - ★★★½
item.description:
So bad that it went all the way around and became good, in a “The Room” type of way

The detectives dialogue feels like a fever dream, the bee puns had me rolling, and all in all I had a very good time
